## News Review for opentext

# OpenText News Review

## Executive Summary

OpenText demonstrated strong market positioning across multiple technology segments during this period, achieving leader status in three separate IDC MarketScape reports for knowledge discovery software, multi-enterprise supply chain commerce networks, and analytical databases ([source](https://prtimes.jp/main/html/rd/p/000000109.000048361.html), [source](https://prtimes.jp/main/html/rd/p/000000108.000048361.html), [source](https://prtimes.jp/main/html/rd/p/000000107.000048361.html)). The company published research showing 67% of organizations have repatriated cloud workloads, positioning itself as a thought leader in hybrid cloud strategies ([source](https://www.techtarget.com/searchcloudcomputing/tip/Plan-for-repatriation-on-day-one-with-a-hybrid-cloud-strategy)). OpenText's AI Data Platform gained recognition in the emerging agentic AI orchestration market alongside major vendors like ServiceNow and AWS ([source](https://www.techtarget.com/searchcustomerexperience/news/366636690/Agentic-orchestration-the-next-AI-issue-for-CIOs-to-tackle)). The company's India operations, employing nearly 6,000 people, faced infrastructure challenges in Bengaluru that could impact operational costs ([source](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/technology/industry-leaders-press-govt-for-area-specific-fixes-to-bengalurus-infra-woes/articleshow/126105610.cms)). Financial activities included filing an automatic mixed securities shelf registration ([source](https://thefly.com/permalinks/entry.php/id4256094/OTEX-OpenText-files-automatic-mixed-securities-shelf)) and a $2 price target reduction by Citi analysts ([source](https://thefly.com/permalinks/entry.php/id4261233/OTEX-OpenText-price-target-lowered-by--at-Citi-heres-why)).

## Key Developments

**Product Recognition and Market Positioning**: OpenText achieved leader status in three IDC MarketScape reports during November 2025, marking the fourth consecutive time for supply chain commerce networks recognition. The company's Analytics Database (formerly Vertica) was recognized for AI-powered petabyte-scale analytics capabilities, while Knowledge Discovery software gained recognition for intelligent classification and metadata enhancement of unstructured data.

**AI Platform Expansion**: OpenText AI Data Platform was included among agent orchestration tools for managing multi-agent AI environments, competing alongside ServiceNow, AWS, Salesforce, and IBM. The platform serves as the foundation for the company's knowledge discovery capabilities and AI transformation initiatives.

**Market Research Leadership**: The company published "The Cloud Repatriation Shift" survey revealing that 67% of organizations have moved workloads from public cloud back to on-premises or hybrid environments, with 87% planning similar moves within two years.

**Operational Challenges**: OpenText's India operations face infrastructure challenges in Bengaluru affecting nearly 6,000 employees, with poor road conditions in industrial areas potentially impacting operational costs and employee retention.

**Financial Activities**: The company filed an automatic mixed securities shelf registration and experienced a $2 price target reduction from Citi analysts, though specific reasoning was not disclosed.

## Market Context

OpenText operates in a rapidly evolving enterprise software landscape where AI integration and hybrid cloud strategies are becoming critical differentiators. The software testing market, where OpenText competes through its Micro Focus division, is projected to grow from $54.11 billion in 2025 to $126.91 billion by 2033 at an 11.33% CAGR ([source](https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2025/12/13/3204990/0/en/Software-Testing-Market-to-Hit-USD-126-91-Billion-by-2033-Driven-by-Rising-Demand-for-High-Quality-and-Secure-Digital-Applications-SNS-Insider.html)). The company faces direct competition from Hyland in enterprise content management, with both vendors making AI pivots to transform legacy systems ([source](https://www.techtarget.com/searchcontentmanagement/news/366636603/Hyland-continues-pivot-to-AI-fueled-enterprise-platform)). In the analytical database space, enterprises face pressure for high-performance analytics on massive data volumes while maintaining security requirements, creating opportunities for OpenText's hybrid deployment capabilities.

## Notable Quotes

**Michael Cybala, Senior Vice President of Engineering, OpenText**: "組織が保有するコンテンツはかつてないほど増加し、そのデータから得られるインサイトに対する顧客の期待も、これまで以上に高まっています。OpenText Knowledge Discoveryの生産性向上機能、理解・変換機能は、コンテンツを戦略的資産へと変革し、お客様がより高いレベルのAI対応と生産性を達成できるよう支援し、効果的な生成AIユースケースのための安全な基盤の拡張を支援します" (Organizations are holding more content than ever before, and customer expectations for insights from that data are higher than ever. OpenText Knowledge Discovery's productivity, understanding and transformation capabilities help transform content into strategic assets, helping customers achieve higher levels of AI readiness and productivity, and supporting the expansion of secure foundations for effective generative AI use cases) ([source](https://prtimes.jp/main/html/rd/p/000000109.000048361.html)).

**Jason Blackett, Vice President of Software Engineering at OpenText**: "企業は膨大なデータに対して高性能な分析を提供するという絶え間ないプレッシャーに直面しています。OpenText Analytics Databaseは、スピードとセキュリティの両方を求めるお客様にとって最適なソリューションです" (Companies face constant pressure to provide high-performance analytics on massive amounts of data. OpenText Analytics Database is the optimal solution for customers seeking both speed and security) ([source](https://prtimes.jp/main/html/rd/p/000000107.000048361.html)).

**Kamal Batra, Director of Learning Services at OpenText**: "the challenge extends beyond building infrastructure to running it effectively" when discussing Bengaluru infrastructure problems affecting the company's operations ([source](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/technology/industry-leaders-press-govt-for-area-specific-fixes-to-bengalurus-infra-woes/articleshow/126105610.cms)).

## Strategic Implications

OpenText's triple IDC MarketScape leader recognition reinforces its position as an established enterprise software vendor capable of competing across multiple technology segments. The company's focus on AI-powered analytics, supply chain optimization, and knowledge discovery aligns with enterprise digital transformation priorities. However, the company faces competitive pressure in AI implementation levels, ranking at L2 tier in both marketing automation and business intelligence tools while competitors achieve L4 full automation capabilities. OpenText's cloud repatriation research positions the company to capitalize on enterprises seeking alternatives to pure public cloud strategies, potentially driving demand for its hybrid and on-premises solutions. The operational challenges in India highlight the need for infrastructure investment to maintain the company's global delivery capabilities, while the securities shelf filing suggests preparation for potential capital market activities to fund growth initiatives or strategic acquisitions.

### Article 3: Industry leaders press govt for area-specific fixes to Bengaluru's infra woes

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/tech/technology/industry-leaders-press-govt-for-area-specific-fixes-to-bengalurus-infra-woes/articleshow/126105610.cms)

## Summary

OpenText's India operations, with nearly 6,000 employees, face infrastructure challenges in Bengaluru including poor road conditions in industrial areas. Kamal Batra, the company's director of learning services, participated in industry discussions about locality-specific solutions to infrastructure problems, emphasizing that effective infrastructure management is as important as initial construction. The challenges affect operational costs and could impact employee retention across the IT sector in Bengaluru.

## Executive Insights

**Kamal Batra, director of learning services at OpenText**

> "the challenge extends beyond building infrastructure to running it effectively"

*Context: Discussing infrastructure problems at a Greater Bengaluru IT Companies and Industries Association event*

*Significance: Shows OpenText's perspective that infrastructure maintenance is as important as initial construction*

### Article 4: A Short History of Performance Engineering

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://calendar.perfplanet.com/2025/a-short-history-of-performance-engineering/)

## Summary

OpenText owns LoadRunner, a prominent load testing tool originally developed in 1991 by Mercury Interactive and later acquired through HP's software portfolio in 2006. The article positions LoadRunner within the historical evolution of performance engineering tools, noting its role as an established commercial solution competing with open-source alternatives like JMeter in the performance testing market. As computing paradigms shift toward cloud and AI technologies, OpenText's performance engineering division faces the challenge of adapting LoadRunner to meet modern testing requirements while maintaining its market position among enterprise customers.

### Article 5: Hyland continues pivot to AI-fueled enterprise platform

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.techtarget.com/searchcontentmanagement/news/366636603/Hyland-continues-pivot-to-AI-fueled-enterprise-platform)

## Summary

The article positions OpenText as a direct competitor to Hyland in the enterprise content management market, noting that both companies are making AI pivots to transform their platforms. OpenText, like Hyland, serves diverse enterprise customers with content distributed across public cloud, private cloud, and on-premises deployments, indicating both vendors face similar challenges in modernizing legacy content management systems with AI capabilities while maintaining compliance and security requirements for regulated industries.

### Article 6: OpenText、2025年IDC MarketScapeレポートの「Worldwide General-Purpose Knowledge Discovery」部門でリーダーに選出

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://prtimes.jp/main/html/rd/p/000000109.000048361.html)

## Summary

OpenText was named a leader in the 2025 IDC MarketScape report for Worldwide General-Purpose Knowledge Discovery Software, with IDC recommending the company for enterprises requiring advanced scalability and real-time knowledge discovery across multiple repositories. The recognition comes as OpenText announced its AI Data Platform roadmap, positioning Knowledge Discovery as central to helping organizations extract insights from large, complex datasets. The AI-powered platform enables content organization, classification, and protection while providing comprehensive visibility across all content types through integrated search, generative AI analysis, and multimedia understanding capabilities. Customer Media Info Groep demonstrates the platform's scale by processing 35,000 search requests every 15 minutes for sentiment analysis across 250 million documents, while Senior VP Michael Cybala emphasized the platform's role in transforming content into strategic assets for AI readiness and productivity gains.

## Executive Insights

**Michael Cybala, Senior Vice President of Engineering, OpenText**

> "組織が保有するコンテンツはかつてないほど増加し、そのデータから得られるインサイトに対する顧客の期待も、これまで以上に高まっています。OpenText Knowledge Discoveryの生産性向上機能、理解・変換機能は、コンテンツを戦略的資産へと変革し、お客様がより高いレベルのAI対応と生産性を達成できるよう支援し、効果的な生成AIユースケースのための安全な基盤の拡張を支援します"

*Context: Discussing the increasing content volumes and customer expectations for data insights*

## Summary

OpenText Analytics Cloud was classified as an L2-level AI implementation in a Japanese marketing automation market analysis covering 31 products. The platform offers AI-driven customer lifecycle mapping that automatically segments customers based on purchase patterns and an AI personalized recommender that analyzes browsing behavior to suggest optimal products. OpenText competes in the mid-tier L2 segment alongside 6 other vendors, while more advanced L3 and L4 automation capabilities are dominated by other players in the market.

### Article 10: Plan for repatriation on day one with a hybrid cloud strategy

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://www.techtarget.com/searchcloudcomputing/tip/Plan-for-repatriation-on-day-one-with-a-hybrid-cloud-strategy)

## Summary

OpenText published survey results from 'The Cloud Repatriation Shift' showing that 67% of organizations have moved workloads from public cloud to on-premises, private cloud or hybrid environments, with 87% planning similar moves within two years. The survey found that 28% of repatriated workloads moved to hybrid cloud environments. This research positions OpenText as a thought leader in cloud repatriation trends and validates market demand for hybrid cloud solutions, potentially supporting their competitive positioning against pure public cloud providers.

### Article 11: OpenText、IDC MarketScapeレポートの「Multi-Enterprise Supply Chain Commerce Network (MESCCN)」部門でリーダーに選出

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://prtimes.jp/main/html/rd/p/000000108.000048361.html)

## Summary

OpenText achieved leader status in IDC MarketScape's 2025 Multi-Enterprise Supply Chain Commerce Network assessment for the fourth time, based on its Business Network Cloud platform that integrates AI-enabled B2B capabilities with over 1 million pre-connected trading partners. The platform supports multiple integration methods including EDI, API, and ERP connections, while providing modular architecture for complex multinational operations. IDC highlighted OpenText's global scale, 1,500-person professional services organization, and ability to handle diverse regional and regulatory requirements, positioning the company as a trusted partner for mission-critical supply chain projects amid current geopolitical uncertainty and supply chain complexity.

## Executive Insights

**John Radko, Senior Vice President of Engineering at OpenText**

> "サプライチェーンに深く関わるお客様にとって、これほど複雑で不確実な時代はかつてありませんでした。OpenText Business Networkは、複数の外部課題によるお客様の負担を軽減し、膨大な取引データからより優れたインサイトを得ることで、業務効率を向上させるためのイノベーションを推進しています"

*Context: Discussing current supply chain challenges and OpenText's response*

*Significance: Positions OpenText as addressing current market pain points through data insights and efficiency improvements*

### Article 12: OpenText、2025年IDC MarketScapeレポートの「Worldwide Analytical Databases」部門でリーダーに選出

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://prtimes.jp/main/html/rd/p/000000107.000048361.html)

## Summary

OpenText Analytics Database (formerly Vertica) was named a leader in the IDC MarketScape Worldwide Analytical Databases 2025 report, recognizing its AI-powered query engine capabilities for petabyte-scale real-time analytics. The platform features massively parallel processing columnar architecture, advanced compression technologies, and hybrid deployment options across on-premises, private cloud, and public cloud environments. Jason Blackett, VP of Software Engineering, emphasized the solution addresses enterprise pressure for high-performance analytics with both speed and security. Key differentiators include in-database machine learning, Kubernetes support, and optimized storage efficiency that reduces total cost of ownership while maintaining enterprise-scale performance for AI-driven data workloads.

## Executive Insights

**Jason Blackett, Vice President of Software Engineering at OpenText**

> "企業は膨大なデータに対して高性能な分析を提供するという絶え間ないプレッシャーに直面しています。OpenText Analytics Databaseは、スピードとセキュリティの両方を求めるお客様にとって最適なソリューションです。膨大な量の情報をほぼ瞬時に分析し、今日の企業が求める柔軟性と保護機能を備えながら、リアルタイムのインサイトを提供します"

*Context: Discussing enterprise analytics challenges and OpenText's solution positioning*

*Significance: Emphasizes dual focus on performance and security as key differentiators in the analytical database market*

### Article 13: 【無料公開】AI実装の段階が一目でわかる ー BIツールのAI実装レベル4層カオスマップ｜2025完全版

**Source:** [View Full Article](https://prtimes.jp/main/html/rd/p/000000015.000035247.html)

## Summary

OpenText Analytics Cloud was classified as an L2-tier AI-enabled BI tool in a comprehensive analysis of 35 major products, featuring Magellan Text Mining capabilities for natural language data analysis, sentiment analysis, and topic extraction with no-code execution. While positioned in the middle tier of AI implementation, OpenText competes in a rapidly evolving market where leaders like Microsoft Power BI and Amazon QuickSight have achieved L4 full automation levels, indicating both competitive challenges and opportunities for advancement in AI-augmented analytics capabilities.
